column4: how many GB should i add as swap for a new ubuntu installation ?
the faq also would have recommendations on size

generally... what Jack_Sparrow says is sensible... but depends on your usage pattern. if you have 4g of ram, and never use it up, you could just throw in a 1g swap for 'just in case' and be ok. to be able to hibernate, need at least as much swap as ram, though.
